titleStmt.title: James C. Brookover to James F. Robinson
CWG8527

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To his Excellency James F Robinson, Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky,

Your petitioner James C Brookover resident in the city of Maysville in the state of Kentucky represents that at the last July Term of the Mason Circuit Court, he was fined the sum of fifty dollars for selling liquor to a slave, such was the Character of the Indictment and the ruling and opinion of the court upon a ,Demeanor thereto as to preclude him from making any successful defence thereto -- It was proved that upon one occasion liquor was sold to a negro, but whether he was a slave witness did not know, nor was there any allegation in the Indictment as to where if a slave to whom he belonged -- he annexes hereto a copy of the indictment and although he may appeal from the Judgement, yet he hopes your Excellency will Issue under the circumstances it a fit case for executive clemency and remit said fine which he respectfully solicits you to do
The undersigned concur and unite in the prayer of the above petition

Jas. C. Brookover Pettn to remit fine
Examd Pettn refused
J F Robinson
